FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: EPA has administratively marked this facility as 'Closed'.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This report is presented in response to the requirements from the USEPA under 40 CFR 112® of the Clean Air Act.  The Schering-Plough Health Care Products facility in Memphis, Tennessee is subject to these regulations because it stores Isobutane and propane in quantities above the listed threshold quantity in the regulation.

The Person in charge of the RMP Program is Mr. Robert Hooper.  Phone number (901) 320-2384.  24 hour number (901) 320-2364

The address for this facility is:
Schering-Plough Health Care Products
3030 Jackson Avenue
Memphis, Tennessee 38151 

This facility is designed to receive, store and distribute consumer health products, most of which are finished consumer products in aerosol canisters. Product research and development laboratories occassionally utilize 20 lb. cylinders of isobutane and propane gas in filling single aerosol cans used in the development of new consumer healthcare commodity aerosol products.

The worst case scenerio for the facility is the ignition of one 20 lb cylinder containing isobutane or propane.  The impact from this scenario is no more than 0.02 miles.  There are no residential, public or environmental receptors within this impact radius. 

From 2006 through 2008, Building 7, a warehouse building, underwent a series of major upgrades to enable it to be reclassified as an Aerosol Storage Warehouse. This building, as of February 2009, is compliant with City of Memphis Fire Dept. and Factory Mutual requirements for the storage of consumer healthcare commodity aerosols. Included in the upgrade projects were the installation of four-fire isolation rooms for "level 3" aerosol product storage as well as the entire building was upgraded to an ESFR sprinkler system including seismic bracing for all overhead sprinkler pipes. 

Schering-Plough Health Care Products is also covered under the OSHA PSM regulations.  Due to the stringent requirements of these regulations, Schering-Plough Healthcare Products has active, on-going accide

nt prevention programs in place in addition to a vibrant safety, health and environmental management system. In 2009, there are various activities that are being directed at preparing the site for application to Tennessee OSHA's VPP Star Program, which is anticipated to be in the 2010 timeframe.
